key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs aligned with LH.com on 88% of itineraries last week and undercut on only 2%, keeping revenue loss to a few basis points.
Meta-search engines priced lower on 91% of queries, making them the most significant source of downward fare pressure for LH.
GDS bookings carried a 20–36% premium on 89% of itineraries, exposing agency traffic to persistent overpricing.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Price alignment on OTAs reached 88.3%, up 1.4 ppts WoW and 3.8 ppts MoM, reflecting improved indirect-channel discipline.
Only 2.0% of itineraries were cheaper on OTAs and discounts averaged just 0.07%, limiting revenue leakage.
Long-haul undercuts still run at 8.6%—four times the short-haul rate—despite a 4.4 ppt WoW improvement.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA did not display the LH fare on 7.2% of ODs; essentially flat WoW and 0.8 ppt better MoM.
Parity cases climbed to a period-high 88.3% (+1.4 ppt WoW).
Undercuts fell to 2.0% (-0.7 ppt WoW) with a negligible 0.07% discount.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 88.4% parity, 1.5% undercuts, and 2.4% premiums—movements all <1 ppt WoW.
Parity drops to 86.0%; undercuts rise to 8.6% and premiums to 3.9%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Domestic origins show 91.5% parity and just 0.6% OTA discounts.
Parity lags at 82.6% with 4.5% undercuts and 10.1% offer gaps.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 87.0% parity; OTA lower and higher shares both ~2.9%, each down ~0.9 ppt WoW.
Best alignment: 91.0% parity with only 0.9% undercuts and 1.8% premiums.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE listed lower fares than LH.com on 91.2% of ODs, up 0.8 ppt MoM.
94% of German POS itineraries are cheaper on MSE, leaving only 3% in parity.
Higher-than-web fares have fallen to 0%, removing upside risk but not leakage.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: ‘Same price’ cases dropped to 5.1% (-0.3 ppt WoW).
91.2% of queries are cheaper by an average 0.07%; frequency up 0.8 ppt MoM.
No instances of MSE pricing above LH.com last week.
Website fare absent in 3.7% of searches—unchanged WoW.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 91% of intra-Europe routes are lower on MSE; discount modest at 0.06%.
Long-haul parity nearly doubled to 6.9%, trimming undercuts by 2.2 ppt WoW.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 94.1% undercut rate with ‑0.08% average gap; high volume magnifies risk.
Undercuts at 86.3% and parity at 8.8%, though negative trend continues.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Within 7 days, 91% undercuts at ‑0.09%, eroding late-booking yield.
91.6% undercuts but smaller ‑0.04% gap; parity down 0.5 ppt WoW.

gds_highlights.line_content: 89% of itineraries are higher-priced on GDS with a 20% average premium.
Average premium ballooned to 36% MoM, signalling rapid deterioration.
Only 52% of long-haul ODs are higher on GDS and the premium is just 4%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: LH fare not found in 6.8% of GDS displays; small uptick WoW.
Only 3.3% true parity—unchanged for four weeks.
Higher pricing systemic: 89.2% frequency with premiums up from 20% to 36% MoM.
Discounts negligible at 0.6% frequency, down 41% MoM.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 92% of intra-Europe itineraries are 21% dearer on GDS.
52% higher with 4% premium; 6.9% are 15% cheaper than LH.com.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 89% prevalence of higher fares but lower 16% premium, showing better control at home.
Premium climbs to 26% with similar 89% higher-fare frequency; discounts twice as common.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 88% higher on GDS with 17% premium; 7.0% missing offers.
Premiums widen to 25% with 91.7% higher pricing in advance bookings.
